mc_user_reviews.text: Hotel for Dogs makes you want to stay home.

Hotel for Dogs is an entertaining family-comedy film which will make you laugh and spend some great time with the family. The story is cute and funny and sometime it  has some drama. Nothing extraordinary but something easily watched
Cliche, boring and only entertaining to kids. Hotel for Dogs falls in the cattagory for one of the worst film ever made. I give this movie 17%. Yeah it is that bad.
This is the worst movie ever because of Emma Roberts, That Director killed the Percy Jackson franchise. Worst acting, worst director and the worst of all, Emma Roberts is the worst
Fun and heartfelt, this is a terrific pick for family viewing. Kids and dog lovers especially will find this winning.
Good over all movie. Granted there are alot of morals being broken in the movie. But if you have raised your kids right and they know the difference between right and wrong. This is a good MOVIE.

"Beverly Hills Chihuahua" in October of 2008, "Marley & Me" on Christmas 2008, and now "Hotel for Dogs" in January of 2009. THREE FILMS centered around dogs in roughly THREE MONTHS. Cleary, the fact that this many films centered around dogs were released in such a short time (after only 2 dog-centric films entered wide-release in ALL of 2007) shows that Hollywood was having some crazy obsession with canine companions. And hey, I love dogs a lot, but just because a film has dogs, doesn't mean it will automatically be good, and that rings true for "Hotel for Dogs." The film is far better than most of Nickelodeon Movies' live-action efforts, and it's safe, harmless, family-friendly fun overall, but by-and-large, it's just too run-of-the-mill to really break out a lot. I can't really say that it's good OR bad, though, it's merely okay. If you have kids, they might get a good laugh out of it, but if you're an adult, you might not enjoy the film nearly as much.

I took my 5 year-old at-the-time son to this at the theatre. It was a charming and decent experience but nothing more--too dependent on CGI rather than a good script. Nice to see Lisa Kudrow and Don Cheadle in a children's film though.
Hotel for Dogs is decent as ever... sadly, it's not working to be a good movie for some people. Dog fans could watch this movie over and over if they wanted to.

It really is just a movie about dogs and their owners. Although there isn't a well-put story to the movie, it maintains its attraction to certain audiences.
